page.title: 11SHERE SCHOOL
page.content: Shere C.of E.First School has 42 pupils in July 1985. It is a split site with three buildings. The oldest building was built in 1842, today this is the school hall. The school helper,Mrs.Askew brought her parents Mr.& Mrs.Woods into the school to talk to us. They both came to Shere school as pupils in 1927. Today they arrived in a 1938 Austin Seven convertable car which we all enjoyed looking at. Their daughter,Mrs.Askew and her daughter came to Shere school as well. We asked if the school has changed? The buildings have not changed. The present hall used to be used for wood work and cookery in the 1930s. Children from other villages came into use these facilities when they were aged between 12 and 14 years.
